name: grass fibre to generic market for energy feed | energy feed, gross | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/4312/documentation

This is a linking activity that converts grass fibres into gross energy for the feed market. ;The naming of the dataset is based on the feed nomenclature system of the National Research Council (USA).  Products with less than 20 percent of protein are classified as energy feeds. Products with more than 20 percent of protein are classified as protein feeds.

The activity starts with the reception of grass fibres

The activity ends with the conversion of grass fibres into gross energy.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals

processDocumentation.samplingDescription: inventory based on gross energy and protein composition of raw material. Data obtained from Agroscope database of feedstuff compositions.

exchanges.description:
Calculated based on formula for calculating the gross energy of straw and grass feedstuff (Agroscope, 2011). 

Gross Energy (MJ/kg dry mass) = 0.0188 * Organic Substances (g/kgDM) + 0.0078* Crude Protein (g/kg DM)

The Organic Substances is obtained from rye straw (OS = 955 g/kgDM), since no specific data is given for grass fibres. The formula for calculating the OS content is based on the ash content (ash content of rye straw is 45 g/kg DM). The dry mass of the reference product is 0.979kg/kg.

OS (g/kgDM)= 1000- Ash content (g/kgDM)
